Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: ok, so here is my basic new story line(while Unity imports)

Author: FishyGuts#5085
TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: - you were an orc slave captured by the evil elves to be sent to a far away continent, but caused by a shipwreck, you ended up on unclaimed territory. All you could salvage was a barrel, and little tool. So you made a fire. (you get randomly spawned on the map)

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: - you now must gather resources: wood, stone and meat. So you must get out there and explore. However, you can't just grind, because your barrel will only hold up that much. So you need buildings/constructs to make your life easier.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: - on the map there are possibly other (up to 3) orcs, but since they aren't part of your clan, and if they are - there is no way to verify - its all about survival; thus you treat them as enemies. There are only so many resources on that map. As long as you maintain ownership of that map, you will get resources over time in the next expansion of your territory.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: - sooner or later you will be able to research, to create better units, but they will be capped to a certain level. However, you can try to sacrifice 2 units, to create a new one, which *might* have better statistics.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: - you can capture wolves for meat or in exchange for meat keep them in a wolves den, so you can have calvary like units.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: - once you are killed as you will be permanently dead. Like protecting the king in chess. Every victory will grant you a reputation point, which increases your leadership skill, that allows to give a special bonus to a certain unit. You can pick between "Ruler" (buff your workers), "Overlord" (buff your combatants) and "Holy" (buff your science and research)

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: To me, that sounds like a fun game to play.
